ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The reemergence of a disorder as diagnosed by clinical and/or laboratory evidence following two or more documented periods of remission.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Chimeric Antigen Receptor Post Therapeutic Procedure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Chimeric Antigen Receptor Post Therapeutic Procedure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cell-surface receptor that has been engineered to combine novel features and specificities from various sources in order to enhance its antigen specificity. Engineered T-cells or B-cells will produce the specialized receptor that will be capable of binding to an epitope on its target cell.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A cell-surface receptor that has been engineered to combine novel features and specificities from various sources in order to enhance its antigen specificity. Engineered T-cells or B-cells will produce the specialized receptor that will be capable of binding to an epitope on its target cell.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gradual decline in amount or activity.: A condition characterized by extremely low B-cell counts. It occurs when anti-CD19 CAR T-cells attack and kill CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.

Concepts.definition: A gradual decline in amount or activity.
A condition characterized by extremely low B-cell counts. It occurs when anti-CD19 CAR T-cells attack and kill CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.
